business.headline: What education sector wants from Budget 2026: Skills, quality and jobsWith India's youth population at the centre of its growth story, the education sector sees Budget 2026 as a chance to invest in better teachers, relevant skills and stronger pathways to jobs.

Tata Technologies' Q3 profit plunges 96% on one-time labour code chargeThe new labour rules, which came into effect in November, require employee wages to make up at least 50% of the total cost to company. Benefits such as provident fund and gratuity must now be calculated based on wages, raising costs for employers.

Gold and silver ETFs at record highs: Should you sell now or buy more?Gold and silver prices have climbed to record highs, pulling their ETFs up sharply as well. With returns looking attractive, investors are now facing a key question, i.e., is this the right time to book profits or stay invested? Let's have a look.

Will gold prices stay near record highs despite easing safe-haven demand?Gold prices are hovering near record highs even as some safe-haven demand fades, raising questions about whether support from interest rate cut expectations and global uncertainty will be enough to keep prices elevated.
Sensex, Nifty end higher driven by IT stocks; Infosys gains 6%The S&P BSE Sensex added 187.74 points to settle at 83,570.35, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 28.75 points to close at 25,694.35​​​​​​​.

Budget 2026: What India's middle class is really asking forWith Budget 2026 around the corner, India's middle class is hoping for relief that actually touches daily life, from jobs and inflation to housing and healthcare, so what is it really asking the government to deliver?

Are frequent market holidays holding India back as a global investment hub?In a post on X, Kamath said that shutting stock exchanges for a local municipal election shows poor planning, especially at a time when Indian markets have strong international linkages and global investor participation.

BCCL IPO listing date changed: Check new debut date, GMP and expected profitBCCL share price: Expectations around listing gains remain strong, as the grey market premium, or GMP, has moved higher. However, the stock's listing has been delayed, pushing the debut to a later date.

IMF likely to upgrade India's GDP forecast after Q3 growth exceeds expectationsIndia's third-quarter growth turned out to be better than expected. This has increased the chances of an upward revision in the IMF's outlook.

Can Budget 2026 address tax, talent and cost pressures in tourism and hospitality?Industry voices highlight the need for skilling reforms, tax incentives, and policy support to drive growth and innovation in India's tourism and hospitality sector.

Amagi Media Labs IPO: Should investors apply?Amagi Media Labs has stepped into the IPO market, drawing attention from investors keen on the fast-growing connected TV and streaming space. With positive brokerage views and steady grey market signals, the key question is whether the issue is worth subscribing to.

Infosys shares rally after Q3 FY26 results: Should you buy now?Infosys stock: The stock opened at Rs 1,670.30, touched an intraday high of Rs 1,683.45 and a low of Rs 1,654.55. The 52-week high of the stock stands at Rs 1,967.75, while the 52-week low is Rs 1,307.10.

Sensex jumps 700 points: Why is the stock market rising todayAt around 10:09 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 410.60 points at 83,793.31. The NSE Nifty50 also moved higher and was trading up 99.80 points at 25,765.40.

Infosys share price jumps 5%: Why is the IT stock rising todayInfosys reported deal wins worth $4.8 billion in the third quarter, a sharp jump from $3.1 billion in the previous quarter. Around 57% of these deals were classified as net new, indicating fresh business additions rather than renewals.
Sensex, Nifty rally as IT stocks jump in early trade; Infosys gains 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 358.23 points to 83,740.94, while the NSE Nifty50 was up 87.55 points to 25,753.25 as of 9:54 am.

TCS headcount dips sharply: Why is India's IT sector facing a job crisisAt the end of Q3 FY26, Tata Consultancy Services said its total headcount stood at 582,163, down by 11,151 employees from 593,314 at the end of the September quarter.

Sensex, Nifty today: Stock markets likely to open higher. Here's why?Market participants are now waiting for earnings announcements from other large companies. Results from firms such as Reliance Industries, Wipro, HDFC Bank and ICICI Bank are expected later on Friday and on Saturday.
Not so 'strait': Hormuz, Iran, and the global oil tradeAround 84 per cent of the crude oil and condensate transported through this strait goes to Asian markets.

Budget 2026: From mental health to medtech, healthcare seeks policy pushAhead of Union Budget 2026, voices from across the healthcare ecosystem are drawing attention to long-standing gaps. While funding has improved in recent years, experts say sharper policy focus is needed on mental health, medtech and early diagnosis.

Supreme Court rules Tiger Global must pay tax on $1.6 billion Flipkart-Walmart dealThe top court ruled that Tiger Global is not entitled to claim tax exemption under the India–Mauritius treaty. It agreed with the Income Tax Department's view that the structure used for the transaction was aimed at avoiding tax liability in India.

entertainment.headline: Explained: What BTS' new album title Arirang means for ARMYs Korean pop band BTS announced their fifth studio album, 'Arirang.'  Know all about the song and what it means for the ARMY.

My 1st tickets were bought by Udupi restaurant boys: Suniel Shetty on early support In an exclusive chat with India Today, actor Suniel Shetty opened up about his early career days. The actor recalled how his first tickets were purchased by the Udupi restaurant team.

Censor board chief opens up on Toxic teaser row, refuses to speak on Jana Nayagan In an exclusive interaction with India Today, the Censor Board of Film Certification (CBFC) chief Prasoon Joshi reacted to 'Toxic: A Fairytale for Grown-ups'. Joshi refused to comment on Yash's 'Jana Nayagan' controversy.

Hangout buddies: Ranbir Kapoor, Aryan Khan's rare photo goes viral A rare photograph of Ranbir Kapoor and Aryan Khan surfaced online, quickly capturing the attention of social media users and fans as both celebrities continue to make headlines for their work in the entertainment industry.

Kareena Kapoor joins '2016 is the new 2026' trend, shares unseen pregnancy photos Kareena Kapoor Khan shared unseen pregnancy photos from 2016. The actor called it the "year of the bump" while giving a glimpse into her throwback memories.

Anil Kapoor on joining NTR and Prashanth Neel's Dragon: Second collaboration of three The upcoming Jr NTR–Prashanth Neel collaboration, tentatively titled Dragon, continues to generate strong excitement ahead of its 2026 release, with Anil Kapoor now confirmed as part of the ensemble.

Netflix locks big Telugu releases for 2026, from Pawan Kalyan to Ram Charan The 2026 Telugu slate announced by Netflix brings together mass entertainers such as Ustaad Bhagat Singh, Peddi and The Paradise, alongside a mix of action, drama and character-driven films.

Dhurandhar 2: Check out what Aditya Dhar said about film's release date Director Aditya Dhar has confirmed that 'Dhurandhar 2' will be released on March 19 as scheduled, dismissing rumours regarding a postponement. The film, starring Ranveer Singh, is set to compete with Yash's 'Toxic: A Fairytale For Grown-Ups' at the box office.

Hrithik–Saba's new 'Ro & Sa' series dives into their Barcelona food trail Hrithik Roshan and Saba Azad continue to share moments from their travels, recently spotlighting a memorable dining experience in Spain. The couple's culinary adventures, shared as part of their 'Ro & Sa Recommend' series, have engaged their followers as they document their relationship and journeys.

AR Rahman on Ramayana music: Hans Zimmer is Jewish, I am Muslim, story is Hindu AR Rahman spoke about his admiration for 'Ramayana' and 'Mahabharata' since they were part of his education while growing up. He praised the values and ideas of the Indian epics that focus on "higher ideals."

Prabhas' Spirit set for March 2027 release, confirms Sandeep Reddy Vanga Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga has officially confirmed the theatrical release date of Spirit, starring Prabhas, with the film now locked for a March 2027 release.

AR Rahman calls Chhaava divisive, thinks core of the film is to show bravery AR Rahman spoke about working in an increasingly divided film industry. During an interview, he highlighted the importance of choosing projects thoughtfully and curating music for Chhaava, a film that he called "divisive."

On Sidharth Malhotra's birthday, Kiara sings for daughter Saraayah's favourite human Actor Sidharth Malhotra marked his 41st birthday on January 16 with a private midnight gathering attended by close friends and family. Kiara Advani posted a heartfelt message and shared moments from the celebration.

Hum To Tere Hi Liye The: Shahid, Triptii capture aching love in O'Romeo new song The romantic song 'Hum To Tere Hi Liye The' from Vishal Bhardwaj's 'O'Romeo' has been released. The song depicts the unrequited romance between Shahid Kapoor and Triptii Dimri's characters.

His & Hers: Netflix brings its most clever whodunit in recent years Netflix's His & Hers reinvents the modern whodunit by placing its protagonists at the centre of suspicion. Smartly written and morally ambiguous, the series keeps questioning your instincts until its devastating final reveal.

The Rip review: Matt Damon, Ben Affleck bring back old-school Hollywood actionRelease Date:Fri Jan 16, 2026 The Rip is a fast, old-school action thriller with great Matt Damon–Ben Affleck chemistry. Set in Miami, it mixes flashy action with a familiar crime plot, making it an easy, late-night watch that Indian audiences will enjoy.

KJo, Kartik Aaryan's shout-out to Border 2 trailer, call it emotional and patriotic Karan Johar praised Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' trailer and commented on the quality of performances in the film. The film is slated to release in theatres on January 23.

Vijay Sethupathi's Slum Dog 33 Temple Road 1st look packs a gritty punch Makers revealed the first-look poster and title of Slum Dog 33 Temple Road, starring Vijay Sethupathi and Samyuktha, as the film wraps up shooting and moves to post-production ahead of a multi-language release.

Actor Mahendran slams Jana Nayagan row: Stalling Vijay's film against free speech Tamil Actor Mahendran criticised the move to stall the release of 'Jana Nayagan'. He said that the move is against India's strong tradition of freedom of speech.

general news.headline: Mahayuti seizes Mumbai crown, Fort Thackeray falls after 28 yearsBMC Election Results: The BJP emerged as the single-largest party, winning 89 of 227 wards and surpassing its 2017 tally. The Uddhav Sena - MNS - NCP (SP) combine managed 72 seats. Contesting alone, the Congress secured 24, while AIMIM surprised with eight wards.

'Dhurandhar' Fadnavis is Hero No. 1 in BJP's Friday Maharashtra blockbusterThe wily Devendra Fadnavis has delivered a Friday blockbuster for the BJP, steering the party towards a near sweep in the civic polls as well as in the BMC, marking the end of the Thackeray family's nearly three-decade dominance.

Mumbai goes BJP's way, Thackeray reunion fails to stop Mahayuti's Maha sweepThe BJP-led Mahayuti alliance swept Maharashtra's civic polls, strengthening its dominance in urban centres and delivering a setback to opposition parties after major political realignments.

Thank You! Trump offers rare praise to Iran after claiming executions were haltedUS President Donald Trump thanked Iran's leadership after claiming Tehran halted the planned executions of more than 800 protesters detained during a violent nationwide crackdown.

Lungi uthi, pungi baji: Did Raj Thackeray's Marathi vitriol hurt Uddhav's Sena too?With the BJP-led Mahayuti taking control of the BMC, the Thackerays are facing a political decimation in Maharashtra. Raj Thackeray's MNS once again squandered a chance to reinvent itself, choosing divisive rhetoric over governance, and the contagion hurt Uddhav's Sena too.

Lin-vincble: A 9-year puzzle that Lakshya Sen failed to solve in windy DelhiIndia Open 2026: There was heartbreak for fans in Delhi as local hope Lakshya Sen — the only Indian left in the draw — crashed out in the quarterfinals. The former champion lost to a familiar foe who adapted better to the conditions, suffering a fourth defeat in a nine-year puzzle that remains unsolved.

Fatter than ever: Trump mocks friend's Ozempic use while talking drug pricesDonald Trump joked that a wealthy friend remains fatter than ever despite using Ozempic, using the anecdote to highlight stark differences between US and UK prescription drug prices.

12 Rajdeep Sardesai takeaways from Mahayuti's big show in civic pollsHeld after a nine-year gap amid fractured alliances and an intense contest over Marathi identity, the Maharashtra civic polls result demonstrated a clear shift in voter preferences. Here are key takeaways from BJP-Shinde Sena sweep of the civic polls.

Living in a post-Blinkit India: What's the hurry? Slow it downIndia is done with the "instant" insanity. Blinkit and Zomato cannot Swiggy by in 10 minutes any longer. Even if they do, they cannot make a virtue out of it. India is not known for doing pretty much anything fast. But now that the government has spoken, we must learn to fill time into a handful of "instant" activities we developed the dangerous habit for.

Pakistani jets on its radar, did Indonesia misfire on BrahMos deal?India is on alert as Indonesia considers buying Pakistan–China co-developed JF-17 fighter jets even while finalising a $450 million BrahMos missile deal with New Delhi.

Jimmy Kimmel says he'll give Trump his trophies on one conditionJimmy Kimmel mocked Donald Trump's fondness for awards, offering him personal trophies if he agreed to pull ICE agents out of Minneapolis amid controversy over a federal immigration crackdown.

AR Rahman calls Chhaava divisive, thinks core of the film is to show braveryAR Rahman spoke about working in an increasingly divided film industry. During an interview, he highlighted the importance of choosing projects thoughtfully and curating music for Chhaava, a film that he called "divisive."

Why the US can batter Iran, but can't bend itThe US has tried it all against Iran, a Shia Muslim country it accuses of trying to get a nuclear bomb. It has crippled its economy with sanctions, struck its nuclear sites and backed its rivals, but Tehran stands defiant. Even a full-blown military strike, what President Trump threatened the Khamenei regime with, won't make Iranians bow down. Here's why.

The Phelps protocol: Swimmer reveals how he programmed himself for successLegendary Michael Phelps has revealed his system for achieving success. Speaking on Raj Shamani's Figuring Out podcast, Phelps explained how he programmed himself for success.

RCB vs GGW Highlights: Bengaluru race to 3 wins in a row, Shreyanka takes 5Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GGW), WPL 2026 Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru raced to their third win in the tournament. Shreyanka Patil picked her first 5-wicket haul in the tournament as the Smriti Mandhana side continued to dominate the points table.

World Champs will be a festival, doubters will regret it: Badminton India secyBadminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra dismissed the intense scrutiny surrounding the India Open, reiterating that the tournament is being staged as a test event for the World Championships, set to return to India after a 16-year gap.

Replacing medicines, India giving Pak a bitter pill to swallow in AfghanistanAn Afghan vlogger has claimed that Indian medicines that are cheaper and work better are fast-replacing Pakistani drugs. India has sent tonnes of medical assistance to Afghanistan even as the Taliban-led regime's ties with Pakistan hit rock bottom. Earlier, Pakistan-made drugs accounted for 70% of all medicines in the Afghan market.

Centre advances 114-Rafale plan to shore up India's air combat strengthIndia and France are aiming to finalise the agreement on 114 additional Rafale jets during a proposed meeting between Prime Minister Narendra Modi and French President Emmanuel Macron in February, sources said.

Legacy over? What spelled the end for Thackeray brothers in BMC pollsBMC election results: Even as Uddhav and Raj Thackeray reunited to revive the long-abandoned 'Marathi Manoos' agenda and pitch against the BJP's Hindutva plank, their efforts fell short. The BJP-led alliance's counter-strategies, careful handling of the Hindi imposition row, and Fadnavis's direct interventions left the Thackerays struggling to reclaim their stronghold.

Yunus govt creates post in UK mission for brother of slain anti-India leader HadiThe interim administration led by Muhammad Yunus has created a post at Bangladesh's UK mission for Omar bin Hadi, brother of slain anti-India leader Sharif Osman Hadi. The move comes weeks after Hadi's murder, which was weaponised by Islamist groups to stoke anti-India sentiments in Bangladesh.

Biting cold wave to continue on Saturday, snowfall likely in KashmirIndia prepares for a severe winter spell with snowfall in the mountains and dense fog in the plains tomorrow. The IMD warns of continuing cold wave conditions across northern and central regions.

How the pre-Islamic Cyrus Cylinder shames rulers of modern-day IranIran's Ayatollah Ali Khamenei's regime is facing scrutiny for widespread human rights violations amid weeks-long protests. Thousands have been killed and tens of thousands have been jailed. But it is the same land that gave the world the first charter of human rights around 2,500 years ago. Here's all about the conqueror, Cyrus the Great, who freed slaves, and his Cyrus Cylinder.

Trump threatens tariffs on countries that 'don't go along' with his Greenland planAfter imposing punitive measures on countries buying Russian oil and enforcing sweeping sanctions on countries involved in trade with Iran, Trump's latest tariff threat is aimed at countries that do not agree to his plan to take control of Greenland.

Trump took Machado's medal, but can Nobel Peace Prize be transferred?Venezuela's Machado gave her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump. This marked the first time in history that a Nobel Prize laureate voluntarily handed over the medal. But can such an award actually be transferred?

sports.headline: The Phelps protocol: Swimmer reveals how he programmed himself for success Legendary Michael Phelps has revealed his system for achieving success. Speaking on Raj Shamani's Figuring Out podcast, Phelps explained how he programmed himself for success.

Lin-vincble: A 9-year puzzle that Lakshya Sen failed to solve in windy Delhi India Open 2026: There was heartbreak for fans in Delhi as local hope Lakshya Sen — the only Indian left in the draw — crashed out in the quarterfinals. The former champion lost to a familiar foe who adapted better to the conditions, suffering a fourth defeat in a nine-year puzzle that remains unsolved.

Doping controversy behind, Sinner sets his eyes on 3-peat at Australian Open Jannik Sinner arrives at the Australian Open stronger after a tough career phase. His comeback and maturity could lead to a third successive Melbourne Park title.

Shreyanka Patil, Radha Yadav combine to sink Gujarat as RCB extend dream unbeaten run WPL 2026, RCB vs GGW: Shreyanka Patil and Radha Yadav starred as RCB extended their WPL 2026 unbeaten run with a 32-run win over Gujarat Giants on Friday, January 16 at the Dr DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai.

Warning to Sinner? Alcaraz makes career slam ambitions clear before Aus Open Australian Open: World No.1 Carlos Alcaraz has sent a rallying cry towards his nemesis Jannik Sinner. Alcaraz has warned Sinner that his entire focus this year will be on the Australian Open, a tournament that he is yet to win on the circuit.

Saurashtra hammer Punjab by 9 wickets, set up Vijay Hazare final vs Vidarbha Vijay Hazare Trophy: Vishvaraj Jadeja's unbeaten 165 helped Saurashtra book a place in the final of the tournament. Saurashtra defeated Punjab by nine wickets in the semi-final on Friday, January 16.

You win silver, you lose: How Michael Phelps built his elite Olympic mentality Michael Phelps has reiterated the ruthless winning mindset that defined his career, dismissing silver and bronze medals as losses rather than achievements. Across five Olympic Games, he won 28 medals, but insists only his 23 golds truly mattered to him.

Shreyas Iyer back in T20Is, Washington Sundar ruled out of series IND vs NZ: Top-order batter Shreyas Iyer has made his return to the Indian T20I side right before the T20 World Cup. Washington Sundar and Tilak Varma have been ruled out of the series.

India Open: Home favourite Lakshya crashes out in 3-game battle vs Lin Chun-yi India Open: The Indian challenge at the India Open Super 750 tournament ended on Friday after home favourite Lakshya Sen lost his quarter-final match against Chinese Taipei's Lin Chun-yi.

Babar Azam wasn't too happy: Steve Smith on turning down single in BBL clash BBL 2025-26: Steve Smith said a tactical decision to turn down a single briefly caused tension with Babar Azam during the Sixers–Thunder clash as he opted to keep the strike.

Liverpool's Slot happy to welcome Salah back from AFCON despite earlier rift Liverpool coach Arne Slot said he was delighted to welcome Mohamed Salah back from Africa Cup of Nations duty, playing down reports of a rift between them just weeks ago.

RCB vs GGW Highlights: Bengaluru race to 3 wins in a row, Shreyanka takes 5Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) vs Gujarat Giants Women (GGW), WPL 2026 Highlights: Royal Challengers Bengaluru raced to their third win in the tournament. Shreyanka Patil picked her first 5-wicket haul in the tournament as the Smriti Mandhana side continued to dominate the points table.

Hard to see how Delhi can host World Champs: Shuttler doubles down on criticismIndia Open: Danish shuttler Mia Blichfeldt has once again criticised the India Open Super 750 competition. In yet another scathing comment, the shuttler said that she was unsure whether Delhi had the ability to host the World Championships later this year.

World Champs will be a festival, doubters will regret it: Badminton India secyBadminton Association of India general secretary Sanjay Mishra dismissed the intense scrutiny surrounding the India Open, reiterating that the tournament is being staged as a test event for the World Championships, set to return to India after a 16-year gap.

Steve Smith goes berserk in BBL, smashes 107-metre six, joint second-fastest centurySteve Smith smashed a sensational 41-ball century, including a 107-metre six, in the Sydney Derby against the Thunder, recording the fastest BBL century for the Sydney Sixers.

Play him first: Nitish Reddy finds support after merciless ten Doeschate attackIND vs NZ: India assistant coach Ryan ten Doeschate slammed all-rounder Nitish Reddy after the team's 2nd ODI loss against New Zealand. However, many, including a former India player, found ten Doeschate's criticism bizarre and slammed the assistant coach for his words.

Kolkata is safe for Bangladesh cricketers, Sheikh Hasina stayed here: Manoj TiwaryManoj Tiwary said Kolkata is safe to host Bangladesh's T20 World Cup matches, stressing that security concerns are unfounded and politics will not interfere with sport.

Some bad moves end the game, some teach you: Vishwanathan Anand on life and chessAt the Jaipur Lit Fest 2026, Vishwanathan Anand spoke about his new book Lightning Kid, sharing stories of childhood, rapid chess, and lessons learned along the way. From family support to handling mistakes, resilience, and modern youth talent, Anand's insights inspire young players to explore the joy of chess while navigating life's challenges.

Jay Shah should have stopped Rohit Sharma's removal as ODI captain: Manoj TiwaryFormer India cricketer Manoj Tiwary has raised concerns over the decision to replace Rohit Sharma with Shubman Gill as India's ODI captain. The former Bengal cricketer said Jay Shah should have intervened and stopped the removal of Rohit.

Give Arshdeep Singh the place he deserves, let him walk with head held high: AshwinRavichandran Ashwin has expressed his concerns about Arshdeep Singh's exclusion from the first two ODIs, raising questions over team selection policies and the impact on bowler confidence.

IPL: RCB proposes AI cameras for crowd control amid talks of exiting BengaluruThe Royal Challengers Bengaluru has proposed installing 300 to 350 AI-enabled cameras at the Chinnaswamy Stadium to enhance crowd safety ahead of IPL 2026. This move follows last year's tragic stampede and aims to reassure stakeholders about safer matchday operations.

Sophie Devine urges review of fielding rules and boundary lengths in women's cricketNew Zealand captain Sophie Devine has called for major changes to fielding restrictions and boundary dimensions in women's cricket, stating current regulations unduly favour batters and hinder bowlers.

Gukesh vs Pragg? India may host Chess World Championship if all-Indian clashAn all-Indian World Chess Championship between D Gukesh and R Praggnanandhaa could bring the showpiece back to India, with Viswanathan Anand saying the clash would be emotionally charged and possibly held in Chennai.

England's World Cup squad must have balance of talent and social skills: TuchelThomas Tuchel has stressed that raw talent alone will not be enough to earn a place in England's World Cup squad, insisting players must also possess the right "social skills" and personality if the team is to have any chance of lifting the trophy this summer.

Does Kohli play ODIs because it's easy? Harbhajan responds to Manjrekar's wild claimHarbhajan Singh defended Virat Kohli after Sanjay Manjrekar called ODIs the "easiest" format, saying greatness isn't about formats and that Kohli remains a match-winner for India.

ICC delegation likely to visit Bangladesh for T20 World Cup talksA delegation from the International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to visit Bangladesh soon for in-person discussions regarding the country's participation in the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, scheduled to be hosted by India and Sri Lanka from February 7.

Who is Henil Patel? Dale Steyn fan is India's 5-star hero in World Cup openerU19 World Cup 2026: 18-year-old Henil Patel made a mark on the opening day of the tournament, picking up a five-wicket haul. The fast bowler from Gujarat idolises Dale Steyn.

Harleen Deol retired-out saga revealed communication gap in coaching: Abhishek NayarUP Warriorz coach Abhishek Nayar said the Harleen Deol retired-out episode exposed a communication gap, admitting that coaching in the WPL has been more hands-on and challenging than expected.

Roger Federer returns to Australian Open, beats World No. 12 in tie-breaker: WatchRoger Federer made a highly anticipated return to Melbourne Park with a spirited practice session against Casper Ruud. The 20-time Grand Slam champion will compete in an exhibition match on Saturday, a day before the main draw of the Australian Open gets underway.

Royal Challengers Bengaluru look to stay perfect against Gujarat GiantsWPL 2026: Royal Challengers Bengaluru face Gujarat Giants in a key WPL 2026 clash, with RCB eyeing a third straight win as Gujarat look to fix bowling issues at DY Patil Stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
